chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: (partial) of sentencing hearing held before Judge Huber on 4/14/16

Clerk: Charli
Case Called: 11:00 a.m.
INCLUDES: 15CF209, 15CF801, 15CF1225
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Def appears in person with Atty Kathryn Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. DEF Filed in 15CF209.

State moves to:
15CF801
Ct. 1 (BJ Felony-Repeater)>> DRI
Ct. 2 (False Imprisonment-DA-Infliction of Physical Pain-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 4 (Disorderly Conduct-DA-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 5 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 6 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force-DA-Sexual Assault- Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 8 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 9 (3rd Degree Sexual Assault-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 10 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 11 (Battery--DA-Infliction of Physical Pain-Repeater)>>DRI
15CF1225
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 2 (Knowingly Violate a DA Order-Repeater)>>DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
15CF209:
Ct. 1 (3rd Degree Sexual Assault)>> No Contest
15CF801
Ct. 3 (Battery--DA-Infliction of Physical Pain-Repeater)>> No Contest
Ct. 7 (3rd Degree Sexual Assault-DA-Sexual Assault- Repeater)>> No Contest
Ct. 12 (Disorderly Conduct-DA-Repeater)>> No Contest


COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt in 15CF209 Ct. 1 - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 5 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty in 15CF801 Ct. 3, Ct. 7, Ct.12. 


COURT ORDERS: 

15CF801:
CT. 3- 2 years imprisonment (1 year IC & 1 year ES); to run concurrent; CONDITIONS: No Contact with Victims M.H. & C.T; SAFE Program including Anger Managment, AODA, and follow up; Counseling/Intake as deemed appropriate by the agent; DNA Sample and Surcharge; 1 DA Surcharges; CC; Register as Sex Offender- 15 years; Letter of Apology to victims if requested.

CT. 7- 6 years imprisonment (2 years IC & 4 years ES); to run concurrent; CONDITIONS: No Contact with Victims M.H. & C.T; SAFE Program including Anger Managment, AODA, and follow up; Counseling/Intake as deemed appropriate by the agent; DNA Sample and Surcharge; 1 DA Surcharges; CC; Register as Sex Offender- 15 years; Letter of Apology to victims if requested.

CT. 12- 2 years imprisonment (1 year IC & 1 year ES); to run concurrent; CONDITIONS: No Contact with Victims M.H. & C.T; SAFE Program including Anger Managment, AODA, and follow up; Counseling/Intake as deemed appropriate by the agent; DNA Sample and Surcharge; 1 DA Surcharges; CC; Register as Sex Offender- 15 years; Letter of Apology to victims if requested.


COURT notes def is eligible for SAP ONLY.
220 Days Credit in 15CF801. No Restitution is request.

DEOJ RH>> 04/01/2021 at 1:10 p.m. 
Bond continues.

Adj: 11:22 a.m.
Plea hearing on April 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Clerk: Charli

State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Def appears with Atty Kat Jackan.

Case Called: 1:46 pm

Adj: 1:50 pm

INCLUDES 15CF1225, 15CF801, & 15CF209 No contact with victim(s):  M.L.H. (dob:  4/16/97) non-waivable, (R.S.H. & J.L.H) OR residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk Becky. 
Case Called: 11:47 am

Preliminary Hearing set in 15CF1225
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Deft appears in custody with Atty Kat Jackan;
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY
Atty Kat Jackan makes request for bond modification.
State does not object;
COURT: $10,000 cash will cover all files with all the original bond conditions remaining the same.
